description.narrative: Solution developed at national and sub national level for sustainable management of natural resources, ecosystem services and waste. Scaled up action on climate change adaptation and mitigation across sectors which is funded and implemented.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: 1) SOP for directorates under MAF, developed and approved 2) Number of people/ geographical area with access to improved climate information services (LDCF Indicator 7) 3) Type and extent of assets strengthened and/or better managed to withstand the effects of climate change (UNDAF Indicator 3.2.3, LDCF Indicator 2) 4) Number of population / households benefiting from the adoption of diversified, climate-resilient livelihood options (LDCF Indicator 3) 5) % change in household income, as a result of mangrove-supportive livelihoods activities implemented by the project 6) Number of funding mechanisms in support of improved coastal watershed management 7) % target population aware of role of mangroves in coastal protection and coastal watershed protection

comment.narrative: 1) Efforts across MAF directorates are not effectively coordinated to ensure the protection and rehabilitation of mangrove areas. 2) 0 – tidal information not regularly collected to inform coastal planning, including mangrove re-afforestaion efforts 3) ~1,300ha or 13km2 in Timor-Leste (2005) - these figures will be updated once the 2014 high resolution aerial photographs are analyzed, followed by ground truthing, to calculate more current mangrove coverage, especially in sites selected for project intervention 4) 0 – project will introduce livelihood options, which contribute to protection and re-afforestation efforts and/or relieve community pressure on mangroves 5) Baseline study to be conducted at start of project to assess current household income levels (see Annex H – Randomized Control Trials) 6) Potential revenue streams identified in NBSAP, as well as PPG assessment, but not yet explored or tested. 7) There is little-to-no educational or public awareness material, especially targeted at youth, about the role of mangroves in coastal ecosystems.

1) Consultant to develop Coastal protection and resilience strategy for infrastructure planning hired 2) Integrated coastal adaptation and management strategic plan of Timor-Leste developed and launched 3) 100 government staff (from Ministry of Agrictulture and Fisheries and Secretary of State for Environment) and Officials from implementing partners / NGOs trained on various capacity building program related to coastal ecosystem management and project management, monitoring, and evaluation and financial management for climate resilience program. 4) Hired Consultant or Researcher to install RSET equipment in targeted sites for long-term monitoring and management of Mangrove Ecosystem 5) 1000 Hectares of Mangrove and Wetland ecosystem protected and conserved through live fence, Local Customary Law "Tara-Bandu", and Mangrove Plantation. 6) 400 Vurnerable coastal households established and engaged in various livelihood activities supported by the project, including Horticulture activity, fish farming, livestock, handycraft, small cooperative/kiosk. 7) Socio economic study conducted to evaluate the % change in households income. 8) 50000 people raised their awareness on the role of mangroves in coastal protection and coastal watershed protection trhough various project interventions, including lecture and presentation in schools and universities, community sensitization, conferences, communication materials and knowledge products shared to targeted audiences, trhough social media, radio, and TV.

1) Consultant to develop Coastal protection and resilience strategy for infrastructure planning was hired on October 2018 and accordingly started her tasks 2 Integrated coastal adaptation and management strategic plan of Timor-Leste developed and was launched on June 2018 3) 26 Implement partner/NGOS' staff trained and enhanced their capacity on progress reporting, report writing, data collection and using GPS for collecting data and monitoring of Mangrove Ecosystem 4) Researcher from Charles Darwin University working to install RSET equipment in targeted sites for long-term monitoring and management of Mangrove Ecosystem hired in 2018 and start working 5) 1258 Hectares of Mangrove and Wetland ecosystem protected and conserved through live fence, Local Customary Law "Tara-Bandu", and Mangrove Plantation. 6) 669 Vurnerable coastal households established and engaged in various livelihood activities supported by the project, including Horticulture activity, fish farming, livestock, handycraft, small cooperative/kiosk. 7) Socio-economic survey is conducted to document the current households income and livelihoods source mainly on the target direct beneficiary to assess the impact of the livelihoods support intervention to the beneficiaries family livelihoods and success of the intervention. The result of study shows promising result that most of the established livelihood groups members's income have been raised as a result of project livelihood intervention. 8) The project management unit was able to mobilize resources from private investors along the coastal mangroves areas for the conservation of mangroves through private public partnership. As a result three companies, ETO and Pertamina fuel company, Heineken and local fish pound owner contributed for the fencing and replanting of mangroves in Metinaro. 9) 30 Households (150 Community members) in Atabae benefited directly from Water Supply Facilities that constructed by the Project 10) The project reached out to more than 50000 of people in Timor-Leste trhough various project's interventions, including lecture and presentation in schools and universities, community sensitization, conferences, communication materials and knowledge products shared to targeted audiences, trhough social media, radio, and TV

1) Develop TOR, 2 TWG Meetings 2) 18 RSET benchmark installed in three targeted mangrove sites. Data collection and monitoring conducted in July & December 2020 3) 450 ha (2020) protected and reforested 4) 45 groups (2020), approximately 500 households 5) At least 20 groups assessed and reported positive % income change in household income 6) Relevant instruments and roadmap applicable to Timor-Leste developed. Partnership established to support the implementation of PES 7) Publications (Lafaek Magazine & Children story books) reaching at least 80,000 households, live theater performances in communities and schools reaching at least 5000 people

1) TOR developed, TWG formalized, 2 TWG meetings held, 1 Joint Monitoring Visit conducted, 1 JMV review workshop 2) ro 3) More than 500 hectares protected and reforested through various means (local village regulation aka tara bandu, plantation and protective fencing) 4) Technical skills training - 22 groups, 81 household, 117 participants (50% women); materials & equipment to at least 10 groups/45 households, more than 20 groups benefiting from CB-EMR activities in 6 municipalities (300 persons) 5) Of the 20 livelihood groups that were assessed/interviewed, 13 groups (~65%) indicated that there has been a positive increase in their income over the last 2 year 6) Viable PES mechanism/scheme, implementation modalities, relevant instruments and roadmap applicable to Timor-Leste developed. Partnership established with local NGOs to support the implementation of PES options for 2021 7) Publications (3 editions of the children and community Lafaaek Magazine & 11 Children story books) reaching at least 80,000 households, 15 live theater performances in communities and schools reaching at least 5,000 people, radio broadcasts in local community radio stations in 3 municipalities, national and community events such as President's plantation campaign, etc.

1) 500 Hectares of coastal ecosystem (Mangroves and Wetlands) Conserved and protected 2) 100% Establishment of Mangroves Sustainability Laboratory in Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries 3) Mapping of Mangroves and Wetland Ecosystem site in Timor-Leste 4) Installation of Rod Surface Elevation (RSET) equipment for Mangroves long term monitoring purposes 5) 1 Development of Coastal Protection and Resilience Strategy for infrastructure planning 6) 100 households benefit from the Establishment of community groups to engage in various diversified livelihood activities, such as fish farming, livestock management, handicraft, small cooperatives / kiosk 7) 2500 people benefit from site Implementation of water conservation and protection and water supply project 8) Public awareness to share information on the importance and functions of coastal ecosystem and environmental protection to at least 50,000 people in Timor-Leste

1) 1000 Hectares of coastal ecosystem (Mangroves and Wetlands) conserved and protected trough live and dry fencing establishment and local customary law / tara bandu implementation, and Mangroves plantation 2) 100% Mangroves Sustainability Laboratory in Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries, General Directorate of Forestry, Coffee, and Industrial plants established 3) 69 sites containing of 4355 Hectares of Mangroves and Wetland Ecosystem area in Timor-Leste has been completely mapped and the result has been shared with government partners 4) 18 RSET equipment have been installed in three municipalities in Timor-Leste to assess the dynamic surface elevation change in the mangroves forest / coastal zones in Timor-Leste for long term Mangroves and coastal zone monitoring purposes 5) 1 Coastal protection and resilience strategy for infrastructure planning in Timor-Leste developed 6) 185 households benefited from 8 new community groups established and engaged in various livelihood activity, 7) 4300 people benefited from project's water conservation and protection and water supply project in the Municipality of Dili, Liquisa, Manatutu and Viqueque 8) 50,000 people reached through various means, including social media and national television, and through direct project interventions to promote awareness raising on the importance and functions of coastal ecosystems and environmental protection.
